metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16669 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
coders/wpg.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file, related to the AcquireCacheNexus function in magick/pixel_cache.c. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-16669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-19
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-19
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-19
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-19
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-19').
